MemberSignature.Value: public static void DecodeBlock (Java.Nio.Buffer? in, Java.Nio.Buffer? out);
.method public static hidebysig void DecodeBlock(class Java.Nio.Buffer in, class Java.Nio.Buffer out) cil managed
Public Shared Sub DecodeBlock (in As Buffer, out As Buffer)
public: static void DecodeBlock(Java::Nio::Buffer ^ in, Java::Nio::Buffer ^ out);
static member DecodeBlock : Java.Nio.Buffer * Java.Nio.Buffer -> unit

Docs.param: a native order direct buffer of size ENCODED_BLOCK_SIZE that contains the ETC1 compressed version of the data.

a native order direct buffer of size DECODED_BLOCK_SIZE that will receive the decoded data. The data represents a 4 x 4 square of 3-byte pixels in form R, G, B. Byte (3 * (x + 4 * y) is the R value of pixel (x, y).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Usage: Android.Opengl.ETC1.DecodeImage (in, out, width, height, pixelSize, stride)

Docs.param: native order direct buffer of the encoded data.
native order direct buffer of the image data. Will be written such that pixel (x,y) is at pIn + pixelSize * x + stride * y. Must be large enough to store entire image.
To be added.
To be added.
must be 2 or 3. 2 is an GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5 image, 3 is a GL_BYTE RGB image.
To be added.

format.a: Java documentation for android.opengl.ETC1.decodeImage(java.nio.Buffer, java.nio.Buffer, int, int, int, int).

MemberSignature.Value: public static void EncodeBlock (Java.Nio.Buffer? in, int validPixelMask, Java.Nio.Buffer? out);
.method public static hidebysig void EncodeBlock(class Java.Nio.Buffer in, int32 validPixelMask, class Java.Nio.Buffer out) cil managed
Public Shared Sub EncodeBlock (in As Buffer, validPixelMask As Integer, out As Buffer)
public: static void EncodeBlock(Java::Nio::Buffer ^ in, int validPixelMask, Java::Nio::Buffer ^ out);
static member EncodeBlock : Java.Nio.Buffer * int * Java.Nio.Buffer -> unit

Docs.param: a native order direct buffer of size DECODED_BLOCK_SIZE that represent a 4 x 4 square of 3-byte pixels in form R, G, B. Byte (3 * (x + 4 * y) is the R value of pixel (x, y).
is a 16-bit mask where bit (1 << (x + y * 4)) indicates whether the corresponding (x,y) pixel is valid. Invalid pixel color values are ignored when compressing.
a native order direct buffer of size ENCODED_BLOCK_SIZE that receives the ETC1 compressed version of the data.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: a native order direct buffer of the image data. Formatted such that pixel (x,y) is at pIn + pixelSize * x + stride * y;
To be added.
To be added.
must be 2 or 3. 2 is an GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5 image, 3 is a GL_BYTE RGB image.
To be added.
a native order direct buffer of the encoded data. Must be large enough to store entire encoded image.
